House Bill/Resolution NO. HB00156
FULL TITLE : AN ACT ESTABLISHING A LOCAL GOVERNMENT RESETTLEMENT PROGRAM THAT IMPLEMENTS AN ON-SITE, IN-CITY OR NEAR-CITY STRATEGY FOR INFORMAL SETTLER FAMILIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH A PEOPLE'S PLAN AND MANDATING THE RELOCATING LOCAL GOVERNMENT UNIT TO PROVIDE OTHER BASIC SERVICES AND LIVELIHOOD COMPONENTS IN FAVOR OF RECIPIENT LOCAL GOVERNMENT UNIT, AMENDING FOR THE PURPOSE REPUBLIC ACT NO. 7279, AS AMENDED, OTHERWISE KNOWN AS THE ꞌURBAN DEVELOPMENT AND HOUSING ACT OF 1992ꞌ
ABSTRACT : Seeks to safeguard the access of informal settlers to their employment and their market for their business through the adoption of an “on-site, in-city, near city” housing policy on resettlement. Mandates a formulation of the “People’s Plan” which shall ensure a constant participation and partnership with informal settler families in achieving the sustainability and the continuity of the resettlement program.
ALIAS NAME : “Local Government Unit Led On-site, In-City or Near-City Resettlement Act.”
